poem:
"Between Frames and Farewells"

In the reel of life's screenplay, an accountant crossed borders.
Mark Shelmerdine, masked in numbers, embroidered dreams to reality.
He breathed in tax sheets, and exhaled Poldark's winds,
Sculpted I, Claudius from the mound of balance credits.
His journey through cancer's cruel maze has ended,
But his vision remains, in the celluloid memories of time.
